body:
On Thu, May 12, 2016 at 2:13 AM, mattn <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Go (or most of programming languages that implement GC like mark&sweep)
> doesn't promise to free all instances. note that some programming languages
> implement GC as auto-release and those promise to free all of instances.
>

I don't think this is correct. Go GC does guarantee the execution of
finalizers
and there are tests to verify that. You just can't know when do that happen,
but eventually they will (you can force GC to make it happen sooner.)
